benchmark_details.name: BICAUSE (Bilingual Causal Chains)
benchmark_details.overview: BICAUSE is a structured bilingual dataset for causal reasoning, including semantically aligned Chinese and English samples in both forward and reversed causal forms, aiming to analyze the impacts of language structure on reasoning in large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically examine how large language models represent causal reasoning across languages and understand the internal mechanisms influenced by linguistic structures.

data.source: Constructed bilingual dataset designed for fine-grained analysis.
data.annotation: Annotated for causal components with conjunction elements.

methodology.calculation: Statistical analysis of attention scores and reasoning accuracy across input samples.
methodology.interpretation: Measures how language-specific biases affect causal reasoning outcomes.
